column3: Smooth and palate-coating, it's 100% varietal, with just the right balance between blackberry and black cherry fruit, and barrel-induced flavors of toffee, toasted macadamia nuts, and café crème.

column2: Nashwauk 2010 Wrecked Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
column3: This wine is dark and inky in color. Nearly impenetrable at first on the nose, this reluctantly giving up hints of plum, cocoa and earth. The plum-pudding palate is dense and weighty, with savory overtones. Give it until 2018 or 2020 to unclench and brighten up.

column2: Mocali 2008 I Piaggioni Sangiovese Grosso (Toscana)
column3: Mocali is a well-established estate in Montalcino and I Piaggioni is one of its super Tuscan wines. This youthful expression of Sangiovese offers hearty cherry aromas with loads of pretty spice and vanilla at the back.

column2: Botter 2011 Caleo Primitivo (Salento)
column3: This exciting selection offers spicy nutmeg and cinnamon notes behind the ripe fruit and prune aromas. A soft, slightly sweet finish is carried forth by the wine's medium density.

column2: Clearwater Canyon 2010 Verhey Vineyard Syrah (Washington)
column3: Hailing from Verhey Vineyard in the Rattlesnake Hills, the Syrah from this Idaho producer has notes of cherry cola, chocolate, and medicine cabinet. It's full throttle with palate coating chocolate notes and tart fruit flavors along with a surprising amount of tannins.

column2: Skouras 2007 Grande Cuvée Agiorgitiko (Nemea)
column3: Black cherry, pepper and smoked meat on the nose are followed by flavors of smoked cherry, vanilla and pepper on the palate. Focused, with a spin of minerality on the finish, this is a versatile food wine.

column2: Pheasant Valley Winery 2009 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (OR))
column3: Rustic and full bodied, this Oregon Primitivo is plenty ripe, yet it retains nuances of olive and herb, along with thick red fruit. A whisper of smoke weaves through the finish.

column2: Pheasant Valley Winery 2009 Primitivo (Columbia Valley (OR))
column3: Rustic and full bodied, this Oregon Primitivo is plenty ripe, yet it retains nuances of olive and herb, along with thick red fruit. A whisper of smoke weaves through the finish.

column2: Alexandria Nicole 2012 Purple Reign Destiny Ridge Vineyard Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: An aromatically intriguing wine with notes of pepper, cherry cola, chocolate and herbs. It's medium bodied, flavorful with generous cherry notes and a fleshy feel.

column2: Sineann 2014 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
column3: Wild berries, from elderberry to salmonberry to mountain strawberries, are in play in this wine. The underpinning scents suggest earth and wet cement, while in the finish a strong flavor of breakfast tea lingers. This is an interesting addition to the Sineann lineup.

column2: Sineann 2014 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
column3: Wild berries, from elderberry to salmonberry to mountain strawberries, are in play in this wine. The underpinning scents suggest earth and wet cement, while in the finish a strong flavor of breakfast tea lingers. This is an interesting addition to the Sineann lineup.

column2: Cinquain 2006 Nagengast Estate Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
column3: An intensely fruit-driven Syrah marked by jammy blackberry, cherry and raspberry flavors, pepper and melted milk chocolate. Delicious and unidimensional.

column2: Snoqualmie 2013 Eco Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Dark berry, herb and fig aromas lead to dense, full and palate-coating dark fruit flavors. It checks all the boxes for varietal correctness, concentration and value.

column2: Bota Box 2013 Shiraz (California)
column3: This deep-colored wine has a concentrated smell like dried figs and lots of ripe blackberry flavors that glide along on a smooth, nicely dense texture. One gulp easily leads to another one.

column2: Gamache 2012 Vineyard Select Reserve Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Woodspice, herb and coffee aromas vie for attention on this blend of Champoux (60%) and Ciel du Cheval vineyard fruit. The black-fruit flavors show a good sense of balance that lingers through the long, mesquite-accented finish.

column2: Bellangelo 2006 Porto Elana Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Finger Lakes)
column3: Cigarbox, pepper and red cherry on the nose leads into vanilla, smoke and cedar on the palate. Rich but not heavy, it will pair well with cured meats, cheeses, heartier dishes.

column2: Phillips Hill 2013 Valenti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
column3: This wine features the signature, woodsy, savory aromas of Phillips Hill. It has a lighter, slightly tawny color compared with most of its peers from Anderson Valley. Flavors combine spice and fruit with meaty, mushroomy notes, giving character and personality to a delicious wine.

column2: Renieri 2009 Tenuta di Renieri  (Chianti Classico)
column3: Wines from the Berardenga area in the southern part of the appellation tend to show extracted fruit flavors because of the clay soils and extra heat. Tenuta di Renieri reflects the region, and it offers bright cherry and chocolate notes.

column2: Cloudy Bay 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
column3: This wine may be on the fleshy, supple side of the spectrum, but it remains grounded in savory spice and earth. Cola and baking spices end on a mouthwatering note.

column2: Frank Family 2012 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
column3: There's a substantive strength and intensity of ripe black cherry to this wine that's well-intentioned in its seamless and soft texture. With just enough of a floral element adding flair to its fleshiness, the wine finishes rich in savory oak.

column2: Liberty Lake 2011 Heritage Reserve Red (Red Mountain)
column3: Aromas of vanilla, pickling spices, green pepper and dark fruit are followed by tart cherry flavors. It shows both the elegance of the vintage and the power of the appellation.

column2: Fenestra 2012 Ghielmetti Vineyard Malbec (Livermore Valley)
column3: Classy and complex oak nuances give the aromas and flavors of this wine a suave, spicy personality. Grilled baguette and cedar notes merge nicely with its focused and concentrated berry and black cherry flavors.

column2: Browne Family Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine seems a bit muddled, with aromas of cranberries, dried herbs, vanilla, cashews and barrel spices struggling to get to the surface. The palate is medium bodied with tart fruit flavors and blocky tannins, with the concentration not seeming to all be there.

column2: Browne Family Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine seems a bit muddled, with aromas of cranberries, dried herbs, vanilla, cashews and barrel spices struggling to get to the surface. The palate is medium bodied with tart fruit flavors and blocky tannins, with the concentration not seeming to all be there.

column2: Abeja 2011 Heather Hill Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: All varietal, this offers aromas of coffee, cherry, chocolate, oak spices and green herbs that show a touch of underripeness. The palate displays elegance, restraint and polish along with a tart finish.

column2: Henry's Drive Vignerons 2012 Magnus Shiraz (Padthaway)
column3: This wine is fleshy and seductive, with irresistible layers of smoke, mint and plum. It's full bodied, creamy textured and lush, staying supple through the long, charming finish. Drink now through 2025.

column2: Razor's Edge 2008 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
column3: A terrific value if you like the style, this is an impressively concentrated, slightly syrupy Shiraz imbued with potent cassis fruit and framed with vanilla oak. Surprisingly long on the finish. Drink now.

column2: Bouchaine 2012 Bacchus Collection Terraces Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
column3: Oaky and tannic at first sip, this wine has a softness waiting to let loose on the palate and reveal more floral cherry and raspberry notes. Through and through, the standout characteristic is dried herb, plenty of it, especially on the finish.

column2: Damsel 2014 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Coming from one of the state's most esteemed Syrah vineyards, this wine opens with nuanced aromas of bacon fat, smoke and berry. The palate is rich and sumptuous, with fruit and savory flavors lingering on the finish.

column2: Damsel 2014 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Coming from one of the state's most esteemed Syrah vineyards, this wine opens with nuanced aromas of bacon fat, smoke and berry. The palate is rich and sumptuous, with fruit and savory flavors lingering on the finish.

column2: Jones of Washington 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas of green and garden herbs, tobacco and cherry lead to generous plum and cocoa flavors. It brings a sense of softness that adds to its appeal.

column2: Wargin Wines 2012 Granite Hill Vineyards Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
column3: Intense color, intense hot aromas and intense blackberry-jam flavors make this an extreme, full-bodied wine. It has plenty of tannins and an overtone of heat in the aroma and the finish.

column2: St. Pauls 2009 Gries Lagrein (Alto Adige)
column3: This opens with dark, inky concentration and savory aromas of leather, spice, tobacco and black fruit. An interesting touch of bitterness appears on the finish.

column2: Pennywise 2013 Merlot (California)
column3: Bold oak aromas like wood smoke and toasted baguette meet almost-sweet flavors like cherries, plums and a bit of maple syrup in this medium-bodied wine.

column2: Tamburini 2009 Italo Riserva  (Chianti)
column3: Italo Riserva harkens back to those old-style Chiantis that once graced the checkered tabletops of your childhood Italian restaurant. That's the inspiration for this wine, perhaps, but the style is modern and bold, with loads of oak spice, cinnamon and dark berry.

column2: Glen Fiona 2006 Basket Press Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: The best of Glen Fiona's current releases, this displays cool-climate varietal character, with mountain berry fruit, herb, spice, tar and a streak of licorice.

column2: Remo Farina 2010  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
column3: Remo Farina is a standout producer with a beautiful portfolio of Amarone and Ripasso wines. This expression shows youthful berry tones that are backed by notes of freshly grated cinnamon and nutmeg. Its consistency is dark and rich.

column2: Remo Farina 2010  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
column3: Remo Farina is a standout producer with a beautiful portfolio of Amarone and Ripasso wines. This expression shows youthful berry tones that are backed by notes of freshly grated cinnamon and nutmeg. Its consistency is dark and rich.

column2: Drumheller 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (OR))
column3: Aromas of milk chocolate, herb, plum and cherry are followed by a palate full of cherry and chocolate flavors that persist on the finish. The tannins bring astringency that provides some distraction.

column2: Wattle Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: A hint of deli meat marks the bouquet of this wine, before smoke, leather and blackberry characterize the palate, the texture soft yet tannic. The finish takes a heartier tone, as the tannins slightly pucker and stick around.

column2: William Church 2013 Tres Bien Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Fresh, savory herb and barrel-spice aromas intertwine, with dark fruit lurking in the background. The black-fruit flavors are supple and show a sense of polish.

column2: Kestrel 2012 Winemaker's Select Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)
column3: Varietal aromas of fresh and dried herbs, flowers and cherries mix with tar, chocolate and barrel spices. The palate displays a reserved styling and a lingering finish.

column2: Domaine de la Petite Cassagne 2013 Red (Costières de Nîmes)
column3: This wine offers a complex, intoxicating bouquet: espresso, charred meat and black olive notes meld seamlessly together, adding notes of blueberries and pastry crust on the palate. It's not overly weighty, remaining fresh through the long, silky finish.

column2: àMaurice 2012 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas of dried herb, clove and plum are fresh. The flavors are supple and reserved, showing a pleasing tension between the fruit and acid that keeps the attention high.

column2: Sightglass 2014 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine, which is 100% varietal, brings aromas of fresh herbs, coffee, toast and char. The palate is rich with dark-fruit flavors while maintaining a lovely sense of balance.

column2: Zaca Mesa 2014 Black Bear Block Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
column3: This bottling from Santa Barbara County's oldest Syrah planting is always like tasting history. Aromas of roasted coffee beans and charred wood meet with pressed blackberry, vanilla and caramel on the nose. The palate combines tart black-plum skins with charred meat, more roasted coffee and lots of cocoa dust, with riper hints of fig and blueberry fruit arising toward the finish.

column2: Stephen Vincent 2013 Crimson Republica de'California Red (California)
column3: An affordably priced wine brings meaty, peppery aromas, interesting fruit, spice and smoke flavors, and a mouthcoating texture. It is full bodied, complex and concentrated.

column2: Ardor 2013 Lawrence Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine starts out brooding, with aromas of vanilla, herbs and brown spices. The cherry flavors are full bodied yet show subtlety, with a captivating mouthfeel and meaty flavors on the finish that increase the interest.

column2: Mercer 2012 Reserve Ode to Brothers Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: This is a blend of Syrah (41%), Grenache (31%) and Mourvèdre. Aromas of vanilla, coffee, game and spice are followed by fruit flavors that seem dried out. Drink now.

column2: Jules Taylor 2009 Ballochdale Estate Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
column3: Sourced from a high-altitude vineyard near the top of the Awatere Valley, this wine shows some of the leafiness characteristic of the region. The fruit is more roasted root vegetable than tree fruit, with a potent savory and fairly muscular character.

column2: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2012 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: All coming from Upland Vineyard, this 100% varietal wine has a lighter color. Supple flavors of coffee, spice, plum, dried herbs and pepper contribute to a finish that lingers.

column2: College Cellars 2014 Anderson Estate Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This wine intrigues with its aromas of peppery spices, tobacco and purple fruit. The flavors are lush and focused, bringing a lot of hedonistic pleasure, though it trails a bit toward the finish.

column2: Keira 2014 G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine is 60% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 5% Mourvèdre. Vanilla aromas are prominent along with prune and other dried fruit. Fruit and barrel flavors intermingle on the palate, with the fruit seeming dried out.

column2: Prominence 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: This is a smooth, thick and tannic wine that's full-bodied, robust and priced to sell. Cassis and blackberry both figure into the mix, along with a finish of tobacco and vanilla.

column2: Cedarville Vineyard 2013 The Rules of Fair Play Red (Fair Play)
column3: A charred, peppery aroma and a stiff, tannic mouthfeel go along with dark-fruit flavors in this full-bodied blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah.

column2: Cedarville Vineyard 2013 The Rules of Fair Play Red (Fair Play)
column3: A charred, peppery aroma and a stiff, tannic mouthfeel go along with dark-fruit flavors in this full-bodied blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah.

column2: Nefarious 2013 Defiance Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (Lake Chelan)
column3: The variety announces itself, with pleasing aromas of plum, boysenberry, black pepper and dried herbs. The flavors are elegant and show a dazzling sense of purity.

column2: Murray 2013 Syrah (Red Mountain)
column3: Coffee, purple fruit and barrel-spice aromas lead to full-feeling blueberry and huckleberry-pie flavors. This wine offers a lot of immediate appeal.

column2: V. Sattui 2012 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)
column3: Impenetrable upon entry, this tannic wine is leathery on the palate, offering notes of cedar, pencil shavings and tobacco. Big shouldered and full bodied, it's powerfully dense and concentrated.

column2: Lingenfelder 2003 Ganymed Spätburgunder (Pfalz)
column3: Shows plenty of barrel influence in its brown sugar and cinnamon aromas, while the flavors run toward cherry, vanilla and coconut. There's a bit of alcoholic warmth to the finish.

column2: Pace 2013 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
column3: Tarry, savory notes of dried beef, soy, charred lamb and underlying blackberry combine for a nose that screams umami. The palate carries a similar effect of grilled, lavender-covered lamb shank, black peppercorns and black sesame.

column2: Gamache 2013 Estate Grown Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Barrel aromas are in the lead here, with notes of sawdust and cedar, along with Band Aid and gamy notes. Dark fruit aromas are in the background. The full-bodied flavors reveal more of the same, showing a lot of heat.

column2: Saracina 2014 Skid Row Vineyard Malbec (Mendocino County)
column3: Big and rich, this full-bodied wine has an aroma like the crema on an espresso and abundant dark-fruit flavors. A wonderful, mouthcoating texture keeps the flavors lingering on the finish. The sense of layering and creaminess that extends after a sip is captivating.

column2: Jean-Luc Colombo 2011 La Louvée  (Cornas)
column3: Plummy and ripe, with a sheen of glossy, cedary oak, this is as plush as it gets in the northern Rhône. It's full-bodied, supple and open, with a long, velvety finish. Drink now–2030.

column2: Stuessy Cellars 2010 My Sweet Petite Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
column3: Dark black like the grapes it's made from. Once you get past its high alcohol, this has powerful flavors of dark chocolate, tar and baked plums.

column2: Adamant Cellars 2006 Winemaker's Select Red Blend Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Lovely concentration and texture make this a standout and the best wine yet from newcomer Adamant Cellars. Berries and cassis fruit flavors are crisply defined and annotated with smoke and earth; the wine has grip and length.

column2: Casa Nuestra 2013 Tinto Red (St. Helena)
column3: A field mix of seven varieties, this is a sanguine, thick and rich wine, softly layered in licorice, fig and cranberry, with a big presence on the palate. Dusty and leathery, it begs emphatically to be paired with pizza.

column2: Nelson Family Vineyards 2007 Estate Zinfandel (Mendocino)
column3: This estate-grown inland Mendocino Zin has an inviting spiciness and is plenty briary with a full body of flavor but its high-alcohol level masks any other nuances.

column2: Etude 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: Truffled compost and chocolate mocha combine for a density of flavor and texture in this approachable, decadent wine. Medium in terms of body and length, it's abundant in leather and burly black fruit.

column2: Winter's Hill 2012 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
column3: A Pommard clone, single-block bottling, this is the most complete and satisfying of the winery's block series of Pinots. Cinnamon toast frames a full-bodied wine loaded with blackberry fruit.

column2: Francesco Boschis 2010 Pianezzo  (Dolcetto di Dogliani)
column3: This has a dark, inky color, with rich aromas of black fruit, spice, leather and soft chocolate. The mouthfeel is smooth and luscious.

column2: Saviah 2013 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This wine offers immediate appeal, opening with aromas of black olive, funk, flowers and moist earth. It does not disappoint, with soft fruit and savory flavors that coat the palate. Meaty flavors add to the enjoyment and the balance is spot on.

column2: Penley Estate 2013 Hyland Shiraz (Coonawarra)
column3: Mouthfilling and round, this wine's savory notes of roasted meat, mocha and cracked pepper frame plummy fruit. Vanilla creeps in on the long, supple finish. Drink now through 2025.

column2: Penley Estate 2013 Hyland Shiraz (Coonawarra)
column3: Mouthfilling and round, this wine's savory notes of roasted meat, mocha and cracked pepper frame plummy fruit. Vanilla creeps in on the long, supple finish. Drink now through 2025.

column2: Lorenzi Estate 2010 Varietal Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
column3: Cooked plums and cherries meet with dill, tarragon, cola and asphalt on the nose of this wine. Rocky flavors of tar and pencil shavings meld with Dr Pepper elements, cedar and more cooked fruit on the palate.

column2: Maryhill 2013 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Maple, black fruit and cocoa aromas lead to lighter styled dark-fruit flavors. The barrel influence at times seems a bit heavy, with the flavors not able to stand up to it.

column2: Balverne 2013 Estate Grown Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
column3: Somewhat muted, this estate-grown wine is most exuberant in pine and dusty cherry. Full bodied and robust on the palate, it retains a grip of tannin from start to finish.

column2: Sanglier Cellars 2014 River Tusque Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
column3: Smoky and seductive in black cherry and a healthy dose of Asian spice, this wine is full-bodied and well concentrated in a thicket of blueberry and gamy meat.

column2: Crux 2014 Grenache (Russian River Valley)
column3: Feral strawberry grabs all the attention in this wildly fierce, high-acid wine that packs a punch in texture, tannin power and body. Small amounts of Syrah, Mourvèdre and Petite Sirah figure into the blend, which is made in minuscule amounts.

column2: Kennedy Shah 2012 Reserve Artz Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: Aromas of blackberry jam, dried fruit and woodspice lead to full-bodied black fruit and vanilla flavors. Despite its youth, this wine seems advanced. Drink now.

column2: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Bastoni Vineyards Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
column3: Earthy and leathery, this medium-bodied, ripe varietal wine dabbles in vanilla, blueberry and coffee cake aromas and flavors, finishing with a welcome softness.

column2: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Bastoni Vineyards Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
column3: Earthy and leathery, this medium-bodied, ripe varietal wine dabbles in vanilla, blueberry and coffee cake aromas and flavors, finishing with a welcome softness.

column2: Wild Coyote 2009 Bragger Syrah (Paso Robles)
column3: Very peppery even for Syrah. Marked also by intense blackberry jam flavors, it's a full-bodied, tannic bruiser, but one with brooding depth. Decant it a few hours before serving.

column2: Gorman 2013 The Pixie Syrah (Red Mountain)
column3: The aromas are brooding, with notes of barrel spice, black licorice and jammy dark fruit. The cranberry and cherry flavors are palate coating and dense—a hedonistic delight.

column2: Speri 2009  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
column3: Speri's delicious Ripasso offers thick concentration and pulpy notes of chocolate and black cherry. The wine is soft, velvety and would pair well with oven-baked pasta topped with hearty meat ragú.

column2: Novelty Hill 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Appealing aromas of cocoa, vanilla and spice intermingle with dark fruit. The palate brings plenty of the same, with pleasing richness and texture to the flavors, and lots of hang time on the finish.

column2: Summit Lake 2006 Claire Riley's Pirate Reserve Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
column3: Viscous and heavy, this 100% Zinfandel made in a Port-like style is intense and chocolaty, a concentrated form of blackberry and blueberry that shows full-bodied richness.

column2: Giovanni Rosso 2007 Serralunga  (Barolo)
column3: Nebbiolo from the Serralunga area of the Langhe tends to veer towards bolder concentration, dark color and thicker aromatic intensity. This expression illustrates this trend very nicely and adds its own distinct layers of licorice and tar to the overall picture.

column2: Holdredge 2014 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
column3: One of the first producers to work with Bucher Vineyard fruit, this shows familiarity and comfort in its ability to coax black cherry, pomegranate and allspice flavors, wrapping them in a voluptuous mouthfeel. Full-bodied and lushly layered, it's lengthy with a touch of smoke.

column2: Sawtooth 2011 Trout Trilogy Malbec
column3: Mounds Bar-like barrel notes dominate the plummy, slightly raisined-seeming fruit found on this 100% varietal wine. The lighter fruit flavors of the vintage can't match the oak's intensity.

column2: Foley 2014 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
column3: Heavy sagebrush and chaparral spices meet with cherry fruit and a touch of asphalt on the nose of this bottling. The palate is earthy with loam and juniper flavors, all woven into dark cranberry fruit.

column2: Merriam 2014 Three Sons Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
column3: Forest pine and sap are further accentuated by this wine's grip of smoky oak, partially offset by the ripeness of full-bodied baked cherry pie at its heart.

column2: Hogue 2012 Genesis Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Pepper, herb and dark fruit aromas lead to silky-feeling fruit and savory flavors. It doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in nicely at the dinner table.

column2: Tertulia 2012 Ryan's Reserve Riviere Galets Estate Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: An inverted GSM with Mourvèdre (80%) taking the lead followed by Syrah (15%) and Grenache, this aromatic wine offers notes of smoke, coffee and peppery spices. It's elegantly styled with a lithe feel.

column2: Massolino 2007  Barolo
column3: This shows ripe fruit aromas of cherry and blackberry backed by leather, smoke and teriyaki notes. Thick and smooth, it has a velvety, fruit-driven finish.

column2: Boomtown 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas of herbs, tar and plum lead to sweet, plush blue fruit flavors. It's not a particularly serious wine but brings plenty of appeal.

column2: Cannonball 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
column3: Deep color, vivid oak, smoky aromas, and rich clove and blackberry flavors. It's full bodied, smoothly tannic in texture and has a lingering finish.

column2: McCrea 2010 Mourvèdre (Yakima Valley)
column3: Aromas of vanilla and baking spices are out in front of fruit leather, herbs and peppery spices. Flavors are exceptionally sweet and ripe, lingering on the finish. Drink now.

column2: Feudi di San Marzano 2011 Sud Negroamaro (Salento)
column3: This bears a dark color with inky concentration. It presents ripe blackberry and prune aromas, followed by chewy softness and a sweet spice flavor.

column2: Peter Paul Wines 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
column3: Smoky and dusty on the palate, this wine is soft and approachable, but also full bodied and ripe. It offers thick layers of chocolate mocha and vanilla.

column2: Nodland 2010 Bad Attitude Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This blend offers notes of herbs, woodspice, black licorice and cherry. It's full of sweet black fruit flavors, with the alcohol riding high and providing some distraction.

column2: Mt. Difficulty 2013 Bannockburn Long Gully Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
column3: This is a sturdy, tannic wine, but one that should come around in a few years. Vanilla, cedar and dark fruit notes have the spotlight for now, with hints of mocha coming on strong on the long finish. Drink 2018–2025.

column2: Mills Reef 2010 Elspeth Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
column3: This wine exhibits pristine Syrah character from the first whiffs of cracked peppercorns, herbs and berries. It's only medium to full bodied, yet finishes long, picking up hints of espresso as it fades.

column2: Jaffurs 2010 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)
column3: Rich, ripe and oaky, this Petite Sirah charms with flashy blackberry, cherry and dark chocolate flavors that are opulent through the long finish. The vineyard is in the Los Alamos region.

column2: William Church 2014 Gamache Vineyards Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This 100% varietal wine comes from older plantings at this vineyard. Aromas of plum, barrel spice and herb are up front followed by sweet black-fruit flavors. It shows hang time on the finish.

column2: William Church 2014 Gamache Vineyards Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This 100% varietal wine comes from older plantings at this vineyard. Aromas of plum, barrel spice and herb are up front followed by sweet black-fruit flavors. It shows hang time on the finish.

column2: Concannon 2006 Selected Vineyards Merlot (Central Coast)
column3: With 10% Petite Sirah, this dark, full-bodied wine is overtly sweet and rustic. It's made in a popular style meant to wash down ribs, pork and chicken dripping with barbecue sauce.

column2: Genius Wines 2009 Creò Clajeux Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
column3: Sanguine and brawny, it's concentrated in dark plum and blueberry fruit, with an earthy element teasing around the edges. The finish is marked by power and grip.

column2: Novelty Hill 2012 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Milk chocolate, cherry and raspberry aromas lead to sweet, supple luscious fruit flavors. It keeps you coming back for more.

column2: De Bortoli 2013 DB Family Selection Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)
column3: For under $10, this wine delivers an admirable blend of cherry fruit and savory underpinnings. Hints of asphalt and black olive finish on a mouthwatering note, joined by the suggestion of caramelized fruit. Drink now.

column2: Robert Ramsay 2014 McKinley Springs Vineyard Mourvèdre (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: This is the winery's eighth vintage working with this block of this vineyard. Aromas of spice, herb and dark fruit lead to sleek pure sweet fruit flavors. It shows a lot of delicacy.

column2: Gustafson Family 2012 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: Front-loaded with cherries, watermelons and pomegranates, with hints of violets, vanilla and spices, this is one of the richer, more full-bodied blush wines out there. Great picnic or beach wine.

column2: Cerro Prieto 2009 La Teresa Bloc Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
column3: Chocolate milk, with a squeeze of cassis liqueur and the sweet vanillins of toasted oak, are the flavors. With the high alcohol, it's almost a dessert wine. Give it credit for a heady opulence.

column2: Helix by Reininger 2011 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Blue fruit, herbs and brown spices vie for attention. The palate brings lighter-styled yet still generous-feeling fruit flavors that linger.

column2: Foppiano 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
column3: Smoky flavor envelops a soft supple layering of blackberry and cherry in this wine, that's big, broad and full of heat. A sweetness of oak provokes the fruit.

column2: Wellington 2010 Mohrhardt Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
column3: An earthy rusticity marks this wine, soft in black cherry, with a rich, smooth texture and grippy, tongue-coating finish of leathery tannin.

column2: Partnership Vineyards 2008 Shiraz (Western Cape)
column3: Sweet mocha is the heart of this wine, with stemmy fruit flavors of black cherry and mashed raspberry providing the supporting frame. A glimmer of hickory smoke accents the long finish. Drink now.

column2: Martin Ray 2013 Merlot (Stags Leap District)
column3: A 100% varietal wine from a great appellation, this has a weightiness of tannin on the entry that softens in the glass, unveiling classical characteristics of blueberry and violet, the oak subtle and spicy on the finish.

column2: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Vanilla, cocoa, barrel spice and herb aromas are followed by creamy fruit and barrel flavors. The vanilla notes overwhelm the nose and palate, however, distracting from the fruit.

column2: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Vanilla, cocoa, barrel spice and herb aromas are followed by creamy fruit and barrel flavors. The vanilla notes overwhelm the nose and palate, however, distracting from the fruit.

column2: Cadaretta 2014 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Huckleberry, blackberry, coffee and bramble aromas lead to full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors in this wine. It's appealing despite the heavy-handed oak.

column2: Baiocchi Wines 2011 del Maggio Grenache-Syrah (Fair Play)
column3: Made from 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah this wine opens with a rich mouthfeel and flavors of tobacco and blackberry jam, layers of smoky meat in the foreground. At 15.9% alcohol it devolves into pruny territory, a tad hot on the finish. Drink now.

column2: Kangarilla Road 2014 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
column3: This is a ripe, supple wine, to the point that the dark fruit aromas feature a bit of a lifted quality. There's chocolate and a bit of plum, and a gently dusty finish that hints at mocha. Drink now–2020.

column2: Ott & Murphy 2012 Grenache (Rattlesnake Hills)
column3: This wine shows a lot of reduction that provides off-putting aromas. The strawberry and cranberry flavors are full and show pleasing purity and length. The disconnect between the aromas and flavors is substantial but some time in a decanter might sync them up.

column2: Popcorn 2014 Chardonnay (California)
column3: Suave and subtle, this medium-bodied wine will be fun to sip through an evening and see how it develops. It emphasizes moderate fruit flavors, subtle oaky spices and a lush texture that keeps the flavors lingering on the finish.

column2: Bontzu 2013 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Vanilla, thyme, dill and plum aromas are followed by plentiful fruit and barrel flavors that possess a pleasing mouthfeel. The oak is out front at times, especially on the aromas, but the wine is appealing.

column2: Sierra Vista 2008 Red Rock Ridge Syrah (El Dorado)
column3: Let this Syrah open, but once it does, it is full of raspberry, black pepper, oak and gamy goodness, medium-bodied, elegant and nicely in balance.

column2: The Crossings 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
column3: The Crossings is based in the Awatere subregion of Marlborough, where ripening is more difficult than the main valley because of cooler temperatures. That evidently wasn't an issue in 2013, as this wine features ripe black-cherry fruit and a creamy texture. Hints of herb and cocoa chime in on the supple finish.

column2: 14 Hands 2014 The Reserve Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: Smoke, char and dark fruit aromas are followed by full-bodied blackberry flavors. The tannins bring some grittiness that holds it back.

column2: Le Fervent 2014 Syrah (Costières de Nîmes)
column3: It's labeled as Syrah, but this wine contains 10% Grenache and 3% Viognier as well, which both serve to plump up the midpalate and lighten the aromatics. Thyme, bayleaf and cherry notes highlight the nose, while the palate is weighty and softly tannic, with a long, silky finish. Drink now–2022.

column2: Ektimo Vineyards 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: Nilla wafer and vanilla creme provide an overly pronounced sense of ripeness in this wine. It's fairly full bodied and rich, without much in the way of nuance.

column2: Stickybeak 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: Dark cherry and vanilla aromas swirl around crisper flavors of rhubarb in this tight, leathery wine made in a restrained, savory style. Made for the table, it'll suit many meals with versatile aplomb.

column2: Sparkman 2014 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)
column3: Klipsun Vineyard provides the fruit for this wine, with 10% Boushey Syrah rounding it out. This wine offers aromas of herb and wet copper penny that lead to full-bodied, boisterous fruit flavors. It the aromas come together it could move up a notch or two.

column2: Helix by Reininger 2011 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of vanilla and wood spice along with herb. The palate brings tart cherry flavors that taper toward the finish. The variety seems to get lost.

column2: Turkey Flat 2009 Mourvèdre (Barossa Valley)
column3: Turkey Flat's Mourvèdre is perennially one of the Barossa's finest. The 2009 is a full-bodied,  creamy-textured example, with flavors of cherries jubilee grounded by savory, meaty notes. A long, mouth-coating finish completes the picture. Drink now–2018.

column2: Barboursville Vineyards 2009 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
column3: Earthy and savory in scent, this has notes of char, smoke and turmeric, which are layered over the black fruit foundation. The attack is pliable, with laidback acids that gain some brightness across the palate. A dusting of cedary spice marks the finish.

column2: Brutocao 2010 Quadriga Red (Mendocino)
column3: A mélange of Sangiovese, Primitivo, Barbera and Dolcetto, this wine offers a rustic personality harking back to the old country from whence all these varieties originally hailed. Big in structure and presence, the wine has more earthy, savory components than rich fruit and is sparse on the finish.

column2: Guillaume Gros 2007 Pourquois Pas Red (Côtes du Luberon)
column3: This may lack the silky completeness of Gros's 2007 Côté Terroir, but this open-knit blend of 50% Grenache, 25% Carignan and 25% Syrah still delivers a bold mouthful of plum and roasted meat flavors. Drink now.

column2: M. Chapoutier 2009 La Ciboise Red (Luberon)
column3: Starts off with slightly confectionary cherry fruit, accented by peppery spice aromas and flavors. The structure is extremely soft, definitely making it a drink-now sort of wine.

column2: Duckhorn 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: Made in large quantities from estate vineyards as well as one sourced site in Rutherford, this wine shows a richness of red fruit and a kick of heat around prominent notes of oak.

column2: Naggiar 2009 Estate grown Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
column3: A broodingly dark, oaky Syrah, this has a dash of pepper and intense red fruit. Naggiar continues to make promising Rhone-inspired estate wines from rocky mountain soils.

column2: Silvan Ridge 2005 Reserve Syrah (Rogue Valley)
column3: I sense some sappy black cherry fruit in here, but it's buried in heavily-toasted barrels and a reductive, plastic flavor that takes over and won't let go. If you give it plenty of extra air time it smoothes out slightly.

column2: Lookout Point 2011 Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)
column3: A single-variety wine coming from Two Coyote Vineyard, it shows aromas of woodspice, dried green herbs and plum.Flavors are soft and fruit filled, trailing toward the finish.

column2: Kilikanoon 2008 Covenant Shiraz (Clare Valley)
column3: This plush, fruit-driven style of Shiraz displays aromas that resemble a cross between Nilla Wafers and graham crackers spread with berry preserves. The flavors follow along similar lines, underscored by hints of chocolate and coffee on the lingering finish.

column2: Brutocao 2010 Hopland Ranches Zinfandel (Mendocino)
column3: A mid-weight Zin, with a tannic backbone and a soft mouthfeel plus, rich and interesting blackberry and coffee. Encrust some ribs, chops or tenderloin in coffee grounds to pair with this wine for explosive results.

column2: Sélection Laurence Féraud 2011 Red (Côtes du Rhône)
column3: This super bargain reflects the charm of the 2011 vintage in its supple tannins and forward fruit. It's lush and creamy textured, with expressive notes of kirsch, spice and cocoa. Drink now–2017.

column2: Andrew Januik 2014 Stone Cairn Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: This wine's aromas suggest bittersweet chocolate, vanilla, cherry and spice. The palate is rich and layered, with sumptuous red and black fruit flavors speckled with plentiful barrel accents.

column2: Folie à Deux 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Lush and thickly concentrated, this crowd-friendly wine offers a brightness of cassis that complements its darker, richer tones of chocolate mocha and clove. Medium in build, it uses its oak well, integrating it into the whole.

column2: Gifford Hirlinger 2012 Estate Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This 100% varietal wine comes off as quite ripe. Aromas of woodspice and caramel lead to full-bodied, sweet and quite boozy cherry flavors, with grainy tannins backing it all up.

column2: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas are high toned and barrel-forward, with notes of vanilla, green wood and cocoa. The fruit is able to break through on the palate that shows a pleasing sense of balance.

column2: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Cold Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Barrel-forward aromas of vanilla and toast are in front of herb and cherry. The palate brings a sense of polish and appeal, with the tannins bringing some squeeze on the finish.

column2: Benanti 2006 Il Monovitigno Nerello Mascalese (Sicilia)
column3: Il Monovitigno is a pure expression of Nerello Mascalese—Mt. Etna's most promising variety—with aromas of black olive, Indian spice, mesquite, black fruit and volcanic ash. It's tonic and fresh in the mouth and encourages a pairing with spicy meat recipes.

column2: Chiarito 2007 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)
column3: John Chiarito is making Italian varieties like Nero d'Avola and Negro Amaro––as well as estate-grown Petite Sirah and Zinfandel––on the outskirts of Ukiah, from his basement winery. There he combines an Old-World sensibility with New World techniques. He's nailing it here with a rustic, tannic but intensely delicious Zin full of berry aromas and a spicy finish. Big and hearty, this wine has soul.

column2: Damsel 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Blended with 10% Mourvèdre and 5% Grenache, with the fruit coming from StoneTree and Stillwater Creek vineyards, this inaugural release offers brambly fruit, smoke, chocolate and peppery spices. It's full of rich, layered but still supple blue and black fruit flavors that linger on the finish, showing a deft mixture of power and restraint supported by a light grip of tannins.

column2: Jinks Creek 2004 Longford Shiraz (Gippsland)
column3: An intriguingly savory Shiraz, laden with meaty, leathery aromas and flavors of pepper-cured meat and coffee. It's full-bodied and creamy in texture, with a lushness that persists through the finish. Drink now.

column2: K Vintners 2013 Klein Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: The aromas start out reticent, with notes of black licorice, kirsch, black olive and earth along with some barrel notes. The flavors are bold, full and palate coating, and are capped off by a lengthy finish.

column2: Pursued by Bear 2012 Baby Bear Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Coming from two area standouts—Lewis and Phinny Hill vineyards—this wine shows appealing aromas and flavors of shaved coconut, Mounds Bar, cherry and baking spices. The barrel influence is prominent but it largely stands up to it.

column2: Pursued by Bear 2012 Baby Bear Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Coming from two area standouts—Lewis and Phinny Hill vineyards—this wine shows appealing aromas and flavors of shaved coconut, Mounds Bar, cherry and baking spices. The barrel influence is prominent but it largely stands up to it.

column2: Dunham 2014 Three Legged Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This wine brings immediate appeal, with notes of blueberry, vanilla and baking spices. The palate is sweet and supple, with plentiful blue-fruit flavors that linger.

column2: JM Cellars 2013 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
column3: Coming from one of the state's premier Syrah vineyards, this wine brings aromas of iron and huckleberry pie. The blueberry and earth flavors are quite ripe, lingering on the finish.

column2: Ott & Murphy 2012 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Coming from one of the state's top Syrah sites, this wine brings aromas of dark fruit, iron and coffee. The fruit flavors are sweet and well proportioned, pulling up toward the finish.

column2: Quivira 2013 Quest Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: Smoky and lined in restrained streaks of black pepper, this is a big-boned, robust and brawny wine, girded by a foundation of tobacco and big tannin. Drink now through 2020 with gigantic slabs of braised or barbecued meat.

column2: Trinity Hill 2011 Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
column3: This is a full-bodied, sturdy wine, bursting with blueberries and baking spices. Licorice adds interest, as do some savory notes of meat, olive and espresso. Drink 2016–2023.

column2: Dusted Valley 2014 Petite Sirah (Wahluke Slope)
column3: This wine's matchstick, dark fruit, vanilla, herb and spice aromas are brooding. It's full and rich on the palate, with dark fruit flavors that linger on the finish.

column2: Northstar 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Cocoa, coffee, baking spice, vanilla and cherry aromas are followed by a reserved palate, full of chocolate and cherry flavors. Coffee notes persist on the finish.

column2: Owen Roe 2013 Chapel Block Red Willow Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
column3: Coming from the oldest Syrah vineyard in the state, this wine brings aromas of herbs, coffee and dark fruit. The flavors are soft and smooth, showing polish and poise along with a finish that lingers.

column2: Bunnell 2012 BDX Discovery Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: Coming from an up-and-coming vineyard, this wine offers aromas of dried herb, vanilla, baking spice and cherry. Fruit and barrel flavors mix on the palate, continuing through the finish.

column2: Helix by Reininger 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Blue fruit and herb aromas are followed by full-bodied blue and purple-fruit flavors. The balance is spot-on and the finish lingers.

column2: The Calling 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Smoky and meaty, with decadent bacon notes, this wine is hugely built and concentrated, its black fruit deeply etched with cigar box and clove accents.

column2: Mazzocco 2014 Sullivan Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: Blended with less than a handful of Petite Sirah, this wine is thick and ultraripe, showing dense chocolate and plum sauce flavors, accented with soy.

column2: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Estate Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: The yum factor on this wine is impossible to ignore, with aromas of jammy blue fruit, dried herbs and cigar box. The concentrated, high-octane flavors are full and textured with a lingering finish.

column2: Cholame 2012 Cross Country Red (Monterey County)
column3: Tar and smashed berries show on the nose, which seems dense yet remains a bit hidden. The palate clings to tar and tart elderberry flavors, with a slight show of lilac and lavender.

column2: Januik 2013 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
column3: Cocoa, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by broad black-fruit flavors. The warmth of the vintage is on display but so is a sense of balance and polish.

column2: AlmaTerra 2006 Coéo Three Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
column3: This is a blend of the three single-vineyard Syrahs from AlmaTerra, and is in some respects more complete, but not quite as interesting as the individual wines. It seems to concentrate the minerality and expand the fruit component, but also becomes blockier, and loses some focus in the finish.

column2: The Counselor 2012 River Pass Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Made by Nick Goldschmidt, this vineyard-designate is 100% varietal and made in relatively small amounts. Sanguine, it's gamy and brimming in black cherry, blueberry, nutmeg and black pepper. It's both robust and soft.

column2: Januik 2013 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)
column3: The aromas bring notes of plum, dark chocolate, clove and barrel spice. The flavors are forward and lush, showing irresistible appeal.

column2: Kestrel 2013 Falcon Series Merlot (Yakima Valley)
column3: This wine's barrel spice, licorice, cranberry and cherry aromas are high toned. The palate is broad, with generous fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.

column2: Santa Barbara Winery 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
column3: Reserved aromatically, this wine from the longtime Santa Barbara producer shows bits of plum, hibiscus and graphite on the nose. The palate is surprisingly lush and punchy, with plum and other dark purple-fruit flavors as well as licorice.

column2: Angove 2013 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)
column3: Full bodied and supple, this is a dark wine with ample fruit. Cassis and black cherry notes pick up hints of cola on the finish. Drink now–2020.

column2: Reaper 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
column3: Blades of spearmint and cardamom are prominent on the nose of this wine, followed by a palate rich in pine and black cherry. Lithe with a dense ripeness, the finish is prickly in Asian spice.

column2: Dewitt 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Smoky and soft, this boldly made wine is medium-bodied but burly in char, baked blackberry and cocoa powder, a hint of tobacco never far.

column2: Dewitt 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Smoky and soft, this boldly made wine is medium-bodied but burly in char, baked blackberry and cocoa powder, a hint of tobacco never far.

column2: Damsel 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Expressive aromas of smoke, embers and blue fruit are followed by a full-bodied flavorful palate that still shows elegance. The finish lingers.

column2: Summit Lake 2010 Sophia Lynn Estate Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)
column3: Brawny in blackberry, blueberry and black pepper, with a shake of cinnamon, this is a soft, complex wine with leathery undertones. From steep, volcanic-soiled vines, it's appropriately tannic without being overbearing.

column2: Coyote Canyon 2013 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Tempranillo (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: Maple and sweet spice aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. Baking-spice flavors linger on the finish. The oak stands out.

column2: Mazzocco 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: A hearty, bombastically high-in-alcohol wine, this offers a combination of grape, plum and leather flavors around a syrupy sweetness of chocolate.

column2: Mazzocco 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: A hearty, bombastically high-in-alcohol wine, this offers a combination of grape, plum and leather flavors around a syrupy sweetness of chocolate.

column2: Louis M. Martini 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
column3: Opaque and thick in color, this bombastically powerful and concentrated wine has pruney sweetness lurking on the back palate, softened by sprinkles of vanilla and black pepper atop a sturdy helping of blackberry pie.

column2: Dusted Valley 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: The aromas are pitch black, with notes of blackberry and black cherry along with high-toned spices. The flavors are full and ripe, with blackberry notes lingering on the finish.

column2: Milbrandt 2012 Vineyard Series Reserve Malbec (Wahluke Slope)
column3: Cocoa, baking spice and blackberry aromas lead to opulent herb and dark fruit flavors. This is high-octane but generally holds it well.

column2: Sbragia 2014 Nonno's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: Pungently earthy in cigar box and compost, this is a compact and densely powerful wine, full of blackberry-jam flavor dipped in chocolate and cinnamon spice.

column2: Hunt Cellars 2010 Rhapsody in Red Destiny Vineyards Red (Paso Robles)
column3: Decadent aromas of kirsch liqueur, pipe smoke and campfire waft from this wine by David Hunt, who is also a blind piano impresario. Leathery flavors of cooked cherries, smoked berries, baked cookies and a strong coffee character power the palate.

column2: Vignerons de Caractère 2009 Roque Colombe G-S-M (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
column3: From the cave cooperative located in nearby Vacqueyras, this is a full-bodied, plushly textured wine that manages to avoid being too soft. Black cherry and garrigue notes are joined by hints of licorice and mocha on the long, layered finish. Drink now–2020.

column2: àMaurice 2011 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: While this wine starts out a bit reductive, it subsequently explodes with aromas of dried herbs and generous amounts of black pepper. It's palate-coating and mesmerizing in feel, showing a dazzling sense of texture, lightness and richness.

column2: L'Ecole No. 41 2013 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: The Grenache (20%) blended in shows itself with its aromas of raspberry and spice complementing Syrah's blue fruit. The flavors are full bodied and lush, pulling no punches but staying in balance.

column2: Latium di Morini 2009 Campo Prognài  (Valpolicella Superiore)
column3: Definitely a big wine, this vineyard-designated Valpolicella has a dark garnet color and thick aromas of ripe fruit, spice and tobacco. The finish is long and smooth.

column2: Madrigal 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
column3: A plethora of smoke and dried tobacco unveils a rustic quality to this estate-grown wine, big in tannin and somewhat diluted in fruit.

column2: Robert Biale 2013 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
column3: The producer's most popular and widely made Zin has a loyal following, and this vintage merits further admiration, offering soft, plummy juiciness on the palate. Not over-oaked, it sparks with black pepper, finishing with elegance.

column2: Robert Biale 2013 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
column3: The producer's most popular and widely made Zin has a loyal following, and this vintage merits further admiration, offering soft, plummy juiciness on the palate. Not over-oaked, it sparks with black pepper, finishing with elegance.

column2: Ross Andrew 2009 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: The Boushey character shines through in this elegant, complex wine. A lovely, sensual mix of loam, mushroom, tobacco and black cherry blends into a stylish wine with exceptional detail all the way through its lengthy finish.

column2: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Cuvée Red (Washington)
column3: Milk chocolate, dark cherry, herb and floral notes are followed by silky smooth pit fruit flavors that linger.

column2: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Cuvée Red (Washington)
column3: Milk chocolate, dark cherry, herb and floral notes are followed by silky smooth pit fruit flavors that linger.

column2: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2013 Canoe Ridge Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: The aromas bring notes of toast, spice and dark fruit. The flavors are pitch black, showing the warmth of the vintage and appellation along with their appeal.

column2: Manara 2009 Le Morete  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)
column3: This has a ripe and succulent quality that is shaped by the wine's plump aromas of black cherry, cinnamon and Spanish cedar. It shows thickness and power, and it would pair with cheesy pasta or meat.

column2: Wilridge 2013 Estate Wilridge Vineyard Syrah-Mourvèdre (Naches Heights)
column3: Syrah (79%) takes the lead on this blend. The blue-fruit aromas seem a touch oxidized—a shame as this wine otherwise shows pleasing purity and persistence.

column2: Cedar Mountain 2007 Hansen Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
column3: Funky with prune and tobacco overwhelming any fresher fruit, this Livermore Zin is high in alcohol (15.8%), which coats the tongue for a long time after the wine goes down.

column2: Ram 2014 Alder Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This is an unusual example of this variety, with aromas of exotic spice, flowers and herb. The palate has tart cranberry flavors that seem lacking in concentration.

column2: Wilson 2014 McClain Primitivo (Alexander Valley)
column3: This wine's nose and palate bring linzer torte, raspberry jam and charred meat to mind. Thick, big-boned and robust, it finishes on sweet vanilla.

column2: Wayne Thomas 2006 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
column3: This full-bodied Shiraz isn't that complex, but it's immediately gratifying for its lashings of vanilla and blackberry fruit. Lush and oaky, it fits the mold of many steakhouse reds.

column2: Tamarack Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas of barrel spice, vanilla, cocoa powder and blue fruit lead to silky, well balanced fruit and barrel flavors. It has polish and poise.

column2: Kason 2013 Old Vine Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
column3: Deep, dark and tannic, this pits black cherry and cassis fruit against thickly applied oak. They wrestle to a stand-off, just about equally matched. Pair this with grilled, well-seasoned salmon.

column2: Tuck Beckstoffer 2010 Semper Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
column3: Marked by oak and thick, dark blue fruit, this wine also conveys a buoyant softness and prettiness. The study in yin and yang characteristics starts with a bang and develops complexity in the glass.

column2: Tuck Beckstoffer 2010 Semper Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
column3: Marked by oak and thick, dark blue fruit, this wine also conveys a buoyant softness and prettiness. The study in yin and yang characteristics starts with a bang and develops complexity in the glass.

column2: Loft 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
column3: Dark-colored, full-bodied and practically sweet with oak, this box wine spreads spicy flavors around the fruit, and becomes more syrupy with each sip.

column2: :Nota Bene 2012 Heart of the Hill Malbec (Red Mountain)
column3: This is the winery's first bottling of Malbec from this up-and-coming vineyard. Woodspice, cedar and mushroom aromas are followed by seemingly dried-out cherry flavors that trail toward the finish.

column2: Goldschmidt 2012 Game Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
column3: Thick and rich, this has saddle and tobacco going on, alongside leather and smoke. A meaty, gamy note akin to bacon also characterizes the wine, as well as jammy blackberry and clove.

column2: Sixto 2013 Frenchman Hills Chardonnay (Washington)
column3: Half-fermented in puncheon with the rest in concrete, this thoroughly enchanting wine offers aromas of cardamom and baking spices. The flavors are broad yet supple, rich yet restrained, displaying impeccable balance and a finish that glides.

column2: Gordon Brothers 1999 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Strong cinnamon and mocha scents illuminate this wine, and the fruit shows some pretty cherry qualities. A bit of dill creeps in too, showing the effect of this cooler vintage on a cooler site. —P.G.

column2: Cline 2015 Syrah (Sonoma County)
column3: Barrel toast and smoky gunpowder scents give this wine a savory edginess before revealing medium-bodied layers of baked blackberry and cherry.

column2: David Clinton 2012 Forté Unti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: A thick, sweet and meaty dessert wine made from older vines, this offers a richness of Dr Pepper, baked plum and dried cherry.

column2: Mondo del Vino 2009 Codici Primitivo (Salento)
column3: Some leather, teriyaki and cured meat notes give this wine a dark first impression. Ripe cherry and raspberry jam flavors appear on the soft finish.

column2: Mondo del Vino 2009 Codici Primitivo (Salento)
column3: Some leather, teriyaki and cured meat notes give this wine a dark first impression. Ripe cherry and raspberry jam flavors appear on the soft finish.

column2: Almquist 2010 Vintner's Select Purple Sage Vineyard Dolcetto (Wahluke Slope)
column3: The aromas offer notes of baking spice, dried fruit and vanilla, seeming to show some oxygen exposure. The cranberry flavors are sweet and tart, with the concentration not all there.

column2: Ambassador Vineyard 2012 Estate Grown Attache Grenache (Red Mountain)
column3: The dark raspberry, plum, herb, vanilla and spice aromas and flavors are rich and high octane. It's not for the faint of heart but offers plenty of appeal.

column2: Baccinetti 2007 Saporoia  (Rosso di Montalcino)
column3: This is a powerful wine, both in terms of alcohol and aromatic intensity. You'll recognize tones of cherry liqueur, blackberry preserves and Indian spice. It's soft and sweeter than most other Rosso di Montalcino.

column2: Hawk Watch Winery 2013 Syrah (South Coast)
column3: There's a touch of barnyard on the nose of this bottling, which also shows a soy and sweet black cherry scents. The palate is marked by beef char and cooked black fruit flavors, with a twist of funkiness, lending intrigue.

column2: Kerloo 2015 Blue Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This wine is expressive, with aromas of violet, herb and purple fruit. The palate is lighter styled and tart, delivering a bit more tannic heft than this variety often shows. Give it some time to open up.

column2: Kerloo 2015 Blue Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This wine is expressive, with aromas of violet, herb and purple fruit. The palate is lighter styled and tart, delivering a bit more tannic heft than this variety often shows. Give it some time to open up.

column2: Ideology 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: Cherry cordial rises to the fore of this rich, thick and full-bodied red blended with 25% Syrah. Velvety in texture, it offers a wealth of meat, dust and chocolate flavors.

column2: St. Supéry 2012 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: A tight, concentrated wine made in larger quantities than many of the producer's other Cabernets, this is approachable and medium bodied, featuring aromas and flavors of savory black tea and olive.

column2: College Cellars 2014 Clarke Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of char, toast and vanilla along with dark raspberry and spice. The palate presents a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter showing a bit too prominently.

column2: College Cellars 2014 Clarke Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of char, toast and vanilla along with dark raspberry and spice. The palate presents a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter showing a bit too prominently.

column2: Januik 2014 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
column3: From one of the state's most esteemed vineyards, this shows prominent toast, vanilla, coffee and marionberry aromas. The palate is considerably more restrained, bringing a sense of lightness. Alone, each delivers, but the two seem out of sync.

column2: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This is a rare, 100% varietal, single-vineyard Malbec. It downright dazzles with notes of dark plum and spice that are followed by seamless, pure, elegant fruit flavors.

column2: Viszlay Vineyards 2013 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
column3: An underlying smoky oak impression complements the succulently ripe, soft blue fruit in this medium-bodied wine. The finish is powerfully rich.

column2: Goodfellow 2014 Bishop Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir
column3: All the right components are in place here, but not yet entirely melded into a complete whole. Stem, earth, nettles and somewhat submerged cherry flavors are in the mix. The finish brings a seam of caramel, and a bit of a back-throat burn.

column2: City Winery of New York 2010 Alder Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendocino)
column3: From a remote vineyard, this generous, well-made wine offers subtle black-cherry aromas, a velvety texture and blackberry flavors. Just moderately tannic, it's softer than some, yet has enough grip in the texture to be great with an indulgent meal.

column2: Bowman Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
column3: This wine is smooth and densely packed in earth and blackberry, the overall tone voluptuously concentrated and full bodied, with a tenacious embrace of ripeness.

column2: Cavalchina 2008 Torre d'Orti Pastoria  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
column3: Beautifully packaged, with a 1920s-style label, this opens with whopping heat and huge chocolate-fudge and cherry syrup flavors. It would be impossible to exaggerate how big and bold this is.

column2: Wellington 2012 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
column3: Meaty and dense, this full-bodied red is expansive on the palate in well-defined layers of leather, blueberry and black pepper flavor.

column2: Villa Toscano 2010 Old Vine Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
column3: Restrained in aromatics, this is a ripe, round and soft ZIn with a Port-like personality, streaks of cedar through the mid-palate and a touch of heat on the finish.

column2: Madrigal 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
column3: Dusty blueberry and chocolate provide heftiness to this full-bodied, densely concentrated wine, which ends simply and without much fanfare.

column2: Antica Corte 2010  Amarone della Valpolicella
column3: This is an unfettered but very enjoyable Amarone, with upfront aromas of black fruit. The palate shows ripe but not exuberant plum and prune flavors, with a hint of chocolate. Pair with seasoned cheeses or braised meat dishes.

column2: Owen Roe 2013 Sojourner Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
column3: This wine lives and breathes terroir, with the rock and wild herb character of the AVA and the vivid cherry fruit of the vineyard. It's beautifully proportioned, with a vein of cola, a toasty bouquet and a focused finish.

column2: Kurtz Family 2000 Boundary Row Grenache (Barossa Valley)
column3: Rich and intense but also round and soft. A horsey note adds complexity and rusticity to the dark chocolate, leather and black cherry aromas and flavors. —J.C.

column2: Parmeson 2014 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
column3: This rustic wine from a site just outside of Healdsburg offers a dense taste of grenadine liqueur and cola. It has moderate structure and plum and nutmeg accents.

column2: Ambassador Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: The aromas are all high toned, with barrel notes of exotic spice, vanilla and medicine cabinet. The red-fruit flavors bring a sense of elegance and distinction.

column2: Margerum 2007 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
column3: If more Syrah tasted like this, more people would drink it. Beautifully ripe and soft, pure and rich in cherry and raspberry liqueur, smoke and pepper flavors. Ready now.

column2: Structure 2014 Upland Malbec (Snipes Mountain)
column3: This 100% varietal wine brings aromas of plum, green herb, vanilla and barrel spice. The flavors are sappy and full, showing a sense of polish.

column2: Structure 2014 Upland Malbec (Snipes Mountain)
column3: This 100% varietal wine brings aromas of plum, green herb, vanilla and barrel spice. The flavors are sappy and full, showing a sense of polish.

column2: Structure 2014 Wallula Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: Wood spice, cherry and herb aromas are followed by luscious cherry flavors. It keeps you coming back for more with a high yum factor.

column2: Northwest Totem Cellars 2007 Low Man Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aggressively tannic, this is an earthy red wine with a lot of barrel influence. The fruit vanishes into a mélange of pepper, clove, coffee and tannin.

column2: Gibbs 2012 Obsidian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
column3: This wine offers a punch of deli meat and bacon on the entry, following through on the palate with a meaty, gamey quality cushioned by soft, sizable tannins. The end goes through a phase of bittersweet chocolate and tobacco.

column2: Artesa 2015 Block 91D Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
column3: Thick and concentrated in black and red fruit, this is a spicy, robust and oaky wine that shows the power of the vintage and site.

column2: Artesa 2015 Block 91D Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
column3: Thick and concentrated in black and red fruit, this is a spicy, robust and oaky wine that shows the power of the vintage and site.

column2: Airfield Estates 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
column3: This is 100% varietal with all of the fruit coming from 1989 plantings. Bittersweet chocolate, green herb and barrel aromas are followed by cherry flavors with a chalky feel.

column2: Conti Zecca 2005 Primitivo (Salento)
column3: This Primitivo has good linearity and well-defined aromas of black fruit and spice. The wine is ripe and succulent, but it is also precise: pair it with grilled meats or pasta with meat ragu.

column2: Revelry 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: This rich wine shows sweet, luscious cherry, green herbs, medicine cabinet and leather aromas and flavors. It doesn't bring a lot of complexity but yields plenty of enjoyment. Drink now.

column2: Jigar 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
column3: This 100% varietal wine from both Alexander Valley and Sonoma Valley sites opens in aromas of raspberry, blackberry and vanilla, tangy and stemmy in the background, with a plume of dusty earth.

column2: Duckhorn 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: Sinewy leather, tobacco and dried herb intertwine on the thick, full-bodied palate in this unfussy red that should appeal to a broad spectrum of tastes.

column2: :Nota Bene 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
column3: Cedar, herb, mushroom and woodspice aromas are followed by tart cranberry and flavors that show some astringency. The wood gets out front.

column2: DanCin 2015 Plié Pinot Noir (Southern Oregon)
column3: One of the prettiest labels in Oregon adorns an equally lovely wine. It's aromatically lush with flowers, body powder and spice. The ripe berry fruit carries a dusting of cocoa powder. Drink 2018–2026.

column2: Les Trouvés 2014 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Mourvèdre (62%) takes the lead on this wine followed by Syrah (21%) and Grenache. It's aromatic and appealing, with notes of roasted meat, black pepper, herb and plum. The red- and black-fruit flavors are concentrated and bring a compelling sense of texture. Smoke and savory flavors linger on the finish. It's a standout at this price.

column2: Cor Cellars 2012 Hogback Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Seeing no new oak, the fruit is front and center. The flavors of pepper, dark fruit and herbs are pure, concentrated and soft in feel with a tart uptick on the finish.

column2: Justin 2013 Focus Syrah (Paso Robles)
column3: This study of density shows blueberry, caramel, vanilla bean, coffee syrup, fudge and concentrated lilac and violet notes on the nose. The mouthfeel is extremely full and the flavors quite powerful, delivering blackberry jam, burnt caramel, touches of teriyaki, mocha and candied pecan. As the alcohol level hints, this is a bombastic bottling, sure to grab any table's attention.

column2: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: There's no denying this wine's appeal with its aromas and flavors of dark fruit, café au lait, earth and herbs. It's restrained yet flavorful, with a lingering, coffee-filled finish.

column2: Wilson 2014 Carl's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: This estate-grown wine is burly, brambly, dense and syrupy, with blackberry, chocolate, cinnamon and leather flavors. Its thick texture persists on the finish.

column2: Corliss Estates 2012 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Café au lait, bittersweet chocolate and blackberry aromas are followed by abundant coffee and black-fruit flavors. It shows layers and density, with fruit and barrel walking hand in hand down the aisle.

column2: Dusted Valley 2013 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Savory herbs mix with clove and barrel spices on the aromas. The palate is full bodied and decadent, with a palate-coating feel.

column2: K Vintners 2013 The Deal Sundance Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Kirsch, brown stem, herb and olive aromas give way to a powerful mouthful of black fruit speckled with savory accents. The finish lingers.

column2: Monte del Frá 2010 Tenuta Lena di Mezzo  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)
column3: Ripasso is a perfect wine for a chilly autumn evening with roasted meat and a roaring fireplace. Hearty and determined, this shows soft black fruit, with barbecue spice and teriyaki sauce.

column2: People's Wine Revolution 2013 Bea's Knees Oberti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
column3: Grapy aromas and bold black pepper and blackberry flavors make this wine big and enjoyable. Full bodied, it has a mouthcoating texture and lingering finish.

column2: Fielding Hills 2010 RiverBend Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
column3: An aromatically brooding wine with notes of cherry, black pepper and barrel spices. It's full bodied with rich flavors and a cranberry lick on the finish.

column2: Watermill 2012 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
column3: Aromas of café au lait, woodspice and dark fruit lead to full-bodied, hedonistic coffee flavors. The style is rich, mixing fruit and barrel.

column2: Hedges 2014 Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: Aromas of maraschino cherry, medicine cabinet, Band-Aid and leather on this 100% varietal wine are followed by slightly dried-out-seeming fruit flavors. Smoke flavors persist on the finish, but the wine presents a sense of elegance.

column2: College Cellars 2012 Cockburn Ranch Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This single-vineyard wine offers wild blueberry with vanilla and herb accents. It's full bodied and high-octane in feel with the flavors running straight down the fairway.

column2: College Cellars 2012 Cockburn Ranch Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: This single-vineyard wine offers wild blueberry with vanilla and herb accents. It's full bodied and high-octane in feel with the flavors running straight down the fairway.

column2: Columbia Crest 2012 Reserve Coyote Canyon Vineyards Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: This wine has immediate appeal with its aromas of coffee, mocha, vanilla and blueberry. The blue and black fruit flavors are concentrated, with a sumptuous feel.

column2: Coyote Canyon 2012 Tres Cruces Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: This wine's barrel spice, barnyard, coffee and vanilla aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors tinged with a strong, distracting gamy note.

column2: Melrose 2008 Baco Noir (Umpqua Valley)
column3: There is a horsey, leathery scent as you first experience this wine. It penetrates into the mouth, a stand-off against the sweet/tart boysenberry fruit. Suspect it will be a love it/hate it type of wine, depending upon your appreciation of leather.

column2: Domaine Boyar 2007 Royal Reserve Mavrud (Thracian Valley)
column3: Earthy on the nose and palate, with prominent mushroom and smoke notes, this is a massively tannic wine, with a hefty serving of pulpy black-fruit flavor. It is full-bodied, with a bit of heat on the finish.

column2: Château de Ségriès 2010 Cuvée Réservée Red (Lirac)
column3: A hint of nail polish or paint thinner prevents this wine from scoring higher. It's full-bodied, with ample dark fruit, but that slight off note strips some of the texture from the midpalate. The finish is warm, with a hint of black licorice.

column2: Beresan 2012 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Blended with 15% Syrah, this is a distinctive wine with aromas of herbs, coffee and vanilla. The palate seems wound up, not quite ready to reveal its charms.

column2: Coyote Canyon 2013 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Primitivo (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: The aromas smell disjointed, with notes of barrel spice, vanilla and maple syrup. The palate is quite sweet and ripe, with abundant baking-spice accents.

column2: Concrete 2014 Tank No. 209 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
column3: Richness and ripeness are welcome traits in this full-bodied, generously flavored and smoothly textured wine. Prune and blackberry aromas continue into the palate and linger a bit on the finish.

column2: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: This is a smoky, moderately tannic and unfussy wine. Layered in black fruit, tobacco, and mocha, it has a sprinkling of cinnamon spice.

column2: Seven Falls 2014 Rapids Red (Wahluke Slope)
column3: Vanilla, mocha and dark-fruit aromas lead to tart fruit and barrel flavors that interweave through the vanilla-filled finish.

column2: Tapteil Vineyard 2010 Red Heaven Vineyard Mourvèdre (Red Mountain)
column3: This Mourvèdre has a pretty cherry flavor, with a suggestion of ripeness that borders on raisining. It also carries interesting details of dried leaf and milk chocolate.

column2: Januik 2012 Weinbau Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)
column3: Aromas of cocoa, coffee, flowers and herbs lead to a velvety palate that possesses a real sense of texture, flavor and balance. The finish lingers.

column2: Hunnicutt 2014 Luvisi Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
column3: This is high-octane and boldly ripe wine from the wilds of Calistoga, offering bacon char, cranberry, plum and a richness of milk chocolate.

column2: Hunnicutt 2014 Luvisi Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
column3: This is high-octane and boldly ripe wine from the wilds of Calistoga, offering bacon char, cranberry, plum and a richness of milk chocolate.

column2: Murphy-Goode 2013 Terra A Lago Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
column3: Richly concentrated and tannic, this wine shows loads of smoke on the nose and palate, but a touch of reduction obfuscates its black cherry and dried herb notes.

column2: Innocent Bystander 2012 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
column3: This lightweight, silky-textured wine features scents of strawberries, tomatoes and campfire smoke. Those same elements appear on the palate, ending without much tannin. Drink up.

column2: Fattoria di Grignano 2007 Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)
column3: From the up-and-coming Chianti Rufina area (an historic wine zone that is currently experiencing a revival of sorts) comes this plush and modern Riserva. The nose generously delivers aromas of black cherry, powdered chocolate and sweet spice.

column2: Poderi Colla 2004  Nebbiolo d'Alba
column3: The nose was interesting; earthy with plenty of plummy fruit and a touch of musk. On the palate, with the fruit more muted, the earthiness became more apparent, and what fruit remained thinned out even more as it reached the finish.

column2: Gnarly Head 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
column3: This jammy, crowd-pleasing Zin is well put-together, soft in blackberry spice and has just a trace of wintergreen on the nose. Widely distributed and value-priced, it's a steal worth stocking up on.

column2: Judge Palmer 2013 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
column3: From this mighty vineyard hails this full-bodied and intensely robust wine, rich and smooth in sinewy texture and sure-to-please blackberry jam and vanilla bean.

column2: Gemtree 2006 Uncut Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
column3: Smoky, cedary notes nicely complement the blueberry fruit in this McLaren Vale Shiraz. It's pretty full on the palate, with a slightly syrupy texture that extends the flavors through a mouthwatering finish. Drink now-2012.
